robot/control/oldikor/IKOR/inform

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001                         IKOR DRIVER                                     
00002  _______________________________________________________________________
00003 |                                                                       |
00004 | FORMAT:  IKOR N<N> M<M> T<IKMethod> D S<METHOD> P O F<type>           |
00005 |_______________________________________________________________________|
00006 | DESCRIPTION:  Takes a method, Task and Joint Space configuration      |
00007 |   and applies a Least Norm (LN) motion with FSP algorithm             |
00008 |   to  solve a  given  trajectory.  CheezyIGRIP can create             |
00009 |   compatible trajectorys.                                             |
00010 |_______________________________________________________________________|
00011 | FILES:  TrajectoryPts         Initial angles & position (dx)          |
00012 |         EulerAngles           Euler Angles for (N>3)                  | 
00013 |         data                  Contains diagnostics (general.h)        |
00014 |_______________________________________________________________________|
00015 |  Elements (Order and Case of parameters is not important):            |
00016 |       T:      IKOR METHOD, values:                                    |
00017 |                    0: FSP Least Norm          (default)               |
00018 |                    1: Moore Penrose Least Norm Pseudo Inverse         |
00019 |                    2: mindx                   (not implemented)       |
00020 |                    3: mindist                 (not implemented)       |
00021 |                    4: FSP Least Flow                                  |
00022 |       C:      CHANGE SPHERES info to data sphere_data file            |
00023 |       D:      DEBUG, prints diagnostic info to data file              |
00024 |       S:      STEP Method:   (No effect with MP-Pseudo)               |
00025 |                    1: One-shot Method         (default)               |
00026 |                    2: Two-step Method                                 |
00027 |       P:      Use Platform                                            |
00028 |                    N: Nonholonomic                                    |
00029 |                    H: Holonomic               (default)               |
00030 |       O:      Use Orientation Control                                 |
00031 |       F:      Fixed Criterion                                         |
00032 |                    l: limits (joints)                                 |
00033 |                    o: obstacles                                       |
00034 |                    i: end effector impact     (not implemented)       |
00035 |                    b: acceleration limits     (not implemented)       |
00036 |                    e[type]: type              (not implemented)       |
00037 |                       1:  semi-sphere         (not implemented)       |
00038 |                       2:  plane               (not implemented)       | 
00039 |                       3:  line                (not implemented)       | 
00040 |       N:      Size of Task Space      (use not recommended)           |
00041 |       M:      Size of Joint Space     (use not recommended)           |
00042 |_______________________________________________________________________|
00043 EXAMPLES:                 RESULTS:      
00044   IKOR flo      | FSP w/JL & OB Avoidance, No platform, No orientation,
00045                 |   One-shot Method,       No Debug.
00046                 |
00047   IKOR o pn fol | FSP w/JL & OB Avoidance, Nonholonomic platform, Orientation,
00048                 |   One-shot Method,       No Debug.
00049                 |
00050   IKOR o ph fol | FSP w/JL & OB Avoidance, Holonomic platform, Orientation,
00051                 |   One-shot Method,       No Debug.
00052                 |
00053   IKOR S1 T4 D  | FSP Least Norm Only,     No Platform, No Orientation,
00054                 |   One-shot Method,       Debug.
00055                 |
00056   IKOR S2 T1 P  | Moore Penrose Least Norm, Platform, No Orientation
00057                 |   Two-step Method,        No Debug.
00058 ** NOTE ** : M and N do not need to be used and are dependent upon the
00059                 specific manipulator chosen.
